channel.title: üè¢ University of Chicago on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Chicago on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: AgentPoison: Red-teaming LLM Agents via Poisoning Memory or Knowledge Bases
item.description: AGENTPOISON: A novel backdoor attack compromises LLM agents by poisoning their memory or knowledge bases, achieving high success rates with minimal performance impact.

item.title: Latent Intrinsics Emerge from Training to Relight
item.description: A novel data-driven relighting model achieves state-of-the-art accuracy by learning latent intrinsic and extrinsic scene properties, even recovering albedo without explicit supervision.

item.title: Off-policy estimation with adaptively collected data: the power of online learning
item.description: This paper develops novel finite-sample bounds for off-policy linear treatment effect estimation with adaptively collected data, proposing online learning algorithms to improve estimation accuracy and…

item.title: Optimal Algorithms for Learning Partitions with Faulty Oracles
item.description: Optimal algorithms for learning partitions are designed, achieving minimum query complexity even with up to l faulty oracle responses.

item.title: Overfitting Behaviour of Gaussian Kernel Ridgeless Regression: Varying Bandwidth or Dimensionality
item.description: Ridgeless regression, surprisingly, generalizes well even with noisy data if dimension scales sub-polynomially with sample size.

item.title: S-SOS: Stochastic Sum-Of-Squares for Parametric Polynomial Optimization
item.description: S-SOS: A new algorithm solves complex, parameterized polynomial problems with provable convergence, enabling efficient solutions for high-dimensional applications like sensor network localization.

item.title: Schur Nets: exploiting local structure for equivariance in higher order graph neural networks
item.description: Schur Nets boost higher-order GNNs by efficiently exploiting local graph structure for automorphism equivariance, achieving improved performance without the computational burden of traditional methods…

item.title: Training Binary Neural Networks via Gaussian Variational Inference and Low-Rank Semidefinite Programming
item.description: VISPA, a novel BNN training framework using Gaussian variational inference and low-rank SDP, achieves state-of-the-art accuracy on various benchmarks.

item.title: Variance estimation in compound decision theory under boundedness
item.description: Unlocking the optimal variance estimation rate in compound decision theory under bounded means, this paper reveals a surprising (log log n/log n)¬≤ rate and introduces a rate-optimal cumulant-based est…

item.title: When are dynamical systems learned from time series data statistically accurate?
item.description: Learned dynamical systems often fail to capture true physical behavior; this work introduces an ergodic theoretic approach to improve statistical accuracy by incorporating Jacobian information during …
